heading: Today
text: Periods of clouds, and a few snow showers ending through the northern mountains, giving way to increasing sunshine, last in the northeast.  Much colder.  Highs in the teens to low 20s north, in the 20s south.  West winds 10 to 15 mph, gusting 25 to 35 mph, diminishing this afternoon.

heading: Tonight
text: Clear early, then periods of clouds developing.  Scattered snow showers developing after midnight through NY into southwest VT, spreading northeast late.  Lows in the teens west and south of I-89, single numbers northeast, rising later at night.  Winds light, becoming south near 10 mph west of the Green Mountains.

heading: Saturday
text: Any breaks of sun giving way to clouds.  Periods of light snow and snow showers increasing. Amounts a dusting to an inch north, 1 to 3 inches south.  Not as cold.  Highs in the upper 20s to low 30s, some mid 30s in southern valleys.  Winds south near 10 mph.
